name: Network of Regional Governments for Sustainable Development
goal:
The Network of Regional Governments for Sustainable Development -nrg4SD is a global association that represents regional governments in the international agendas on climate change, biodiversity and sustainable development. Established in 2002, today it has over 50 members from 26 countries in 4 continents. The nrg4SD is the only international network on sustainable development matters representing solely subnational governments. It serves as the voice of regional governments at the United Nations (UN) negotiations, European Union initiatives and global discussions. The nrg4SD facilitates cooperation projects and partnerships between members and with international experts, as well as promotes expertise exchange, capacity building and knowledge transfer to assist in the implementation
of international commitments. In addition, the nrg4SD advocates for recognition and supports further engagement of regional governments in the global agendas.
The nrg4SD also acts as Secretariat of the RegionsAdapt initiative, an initiative dedicated to adaptation on the regional level, as well as the Regions for Biodiversity Learning Platform, a global community of regional governments working together to conserve and protect biodiversity, encourage healthy ecosystems, and promote sustainable livelihoods for their citizens.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Development, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Humanitarian Aid, Public Health, Regional Policy, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
